Generation IV.Diamond: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation IV.Pearl: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...

Generation V.Black: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
Generation V.White: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
Generation V.Black 2: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
Generation V.White 2: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.

Generation VI.X: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation VI.Y: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...

Generation VII.Sun: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
Generation VII.Moon: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.

Generation VIII.Sword: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z's behavior.
Generation VIII.Shield: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can't agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Additional software was installed to make it an even better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Additional software was installed to make it an even better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

Generation IX.Scarlet: An additional program was installed to create a more advanced Pokémon, but it was apparently flawed. Porygon-Z moves oddly as a result.
Generation IX.Violet: Its programming was modified to enable it to operate in other dimensions. This did not work as planned.
